sentence.Network_en: It is wrong to belittle or neglect popularization.
sentence.Network_cn: 轻视和忽视普及工作的态度是错误的.

sentence.Network_en: If popularization remains at the same level for ever, won't the educators and those being educated be six of one and half a dozen of the other?
sentence.Network_cn: 如果普及工作永远停留在一个水平上, 那么教育者和被教育者岂不都是半斤八两?

sentence.Network_en: To administer centrally the law popularization and education in the customs institutions.
sentence.Network_cn: 归口管理海关系统的普法教育.

entry.def: To popularize something means to make a lot of people interested in it and able to enjoy it.

example.ex: Irving Brokaw popularized figure skating in the US.
example.tran: 欧文·布罗考在美国引发了花样滑冰热潮。

entry.def: To popularize an academic subject or scientific idea means to make it more easy to understand  for ordinary people.

example.ex: It was Aristotle who proved the world is round. Plato popularized the concept.
example.tran: 亚里士多德证明了地球是圆的，柏拉图普及了这一概念。

means.word_mean: 1. an interpretation that easily understandable and acceptable
2. the act of making something attractive to the general public

stems_affixes.word_buile: popul人民+ous……的→adj.人口稠密的;人口多的
popul人民[平民]+ace名词字尾→n.平民,大众
popular流行的+ity性质→n.大众性,通俗性
popularize大众化,推广+ation表名词→n.普及,推广,通俗化
popul人民+ation表名词→n.全体居民,人口

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使[某地]人口减少,减少人口

popular流行的+ize……化,使……→v.[使]大众化,[使]普及,推广

re一再+populate使人民重新居住于…→v.使人民重新居住于…
